every year there are over 12,000 fires and hotels across the United States because I travel so much I decided to learn what to do to help me get out of safety should I ever encounter a fire situation I'd like to share what I've learned with you the first thing I do no matter how tired I am is to check my hotel room for smoke detectors and fire sprinklers I won't stay in a hotel that doesn't have all this kind of fire protection next I check for exits in the

like Windows or adjoining doors to the windows open easily is there a balcony or allege how high up am I I know I would never jump and fire above the first or second story then I go out into the hallway and check for the closest fire exit which way is it how far how many dogs do I have to pass to get there is anything blocking my path does the fire exit lead to a staircase or another Corridor it's the whole way were filled with smoke

poke would I remember how to get to the exit when I get back into my room I make sure I put my key in the same place every time I checked the location of the telephone and jot down the number of the fire department I'd call them first in case of a fire then I notify the switchboard all these little details take less than five minutes but they might be the best five minutes I ever spent
